title: Lifesaving scientific tools made of paper
description: Inventor Manu Prakash turns everyday materials into powerful scientific devices, from paper microscopes to a clever new mosquito tracker. From the TED Fellows stage, he demos Paperfuge, a hand-powered centrifuge inspired by a spinning toy that costs 20 cents to make and can do the work of a $1,000 machine, no electricity required.
author: Manu Prakash
keywords: TED, talks, disease, innovation, health care, invention, product design, TED Fellows, medicine
